description.summary: Bridge input capture to the compositor

protocol.description: This protocol is a bridge of the XDG input capture to the compositor.

interface.name: hyprland_input_capture_manager_v1
interface.description: This interface allows to create an input capture session.

interface.name: hyprland_input_capture_v1

description.summary: close reproduction of the xdg input capture portal

interface.description: Interface that is used to create barrier, and trigger capture and release of the pointer. The inputs are sent through an EIS socket, when the cursor hit a barrier. Barriers can only be placed on screen edges and need to be a straight line that cover one corner to another.

request.name: clear_barriers
request.description: Remove every barriers from the session, new barriers need to be send before calling enable again.

request.name: add_barrier
request.description: Add one barrier to the current session, the barrier need to a line placed on the edge of the screen, and is a straight line from one corner to another.

request.name: enable
request.description: Enable the input capturing to be triggered by the cursor crossing a barrier.

request.name: disable
request.description: Disable input capturing, the crossing of a barrier will not trigger anymore input capture.

request.name: release
request.description: Release input capturing, the input are not intercepted anymore and barrier crossing will activate it again. If x != -1 and y != -1 then the cursor is warped to the x and y coordinates.

arg.name: activation_id
arg.summary: The activation id provided when activated is called

arg.name: x
arg.summary: the x position of the cursor

arg.name: y
arg.summary: the y position of the cursor

event.name: eis_fd
event.description: This event provide the file descriptor of an eis socket where inputs will be sent when input capturing is active

event.name: disabled
event.description: Called when the application will not receive captured input. The application can call enable to request future input capturing

event.name: activated
event.description: Called when the application is about to receive inputs

arg.name: activation_id
arg.summary: Same number used in eis start_emulating to allow synchronisation

arg.name: x
arg.summary: the x position of the cursor

arg.name: y
arg.summary: the y position of the cursor

arg.name: barrier_id
arg.summary: the is of the barrier that have been triggered

event.name: deactivated
event.description: Called when input capture is stopped, and inputs are no longer sent to the application

arg.name: activation_id
arg.summary: same activation id of the latest activated event

entry.name: invalid_activation_id
entry.summary: The activation id provided is invalid
